reviews.text: I stayed at NH for a weekend and was quite satisified. The rooms are unusually large for a European hotel. The bed was particularly comfortable.
reviews.title: Good value for money hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is well located for the shops (antique/furniture especially) and a short walk from virtually anywhere in central Budapest. There is nothing about this property that could possibly wow you, but the rooms are comfortable if a little tired and rates, especially through sites such as Priceline name your price, are extremely reasonable.
reviews.title: Functional and well positioned

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you end up staying here you could have done a lot worse!
reviews.title: good price, good position, nice room

reviews.text: very nice hotel, room very confortable and clean, good position to visit budapest. we paied 110 Euros fer 2 nights, very good price considering the hotel quality.
reviews.title: Reasonable value and key things right, but design and service faults

reviews.text: only the girls at the reception were not very good with giving info and I think they were under-staffed (on e more people would be good)
reviews.title: Very reasonable although the rooms are nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: clean rooms, friendly stuff, very good breakfast. The only bad thing is the view. We could see from our window an old wall from a building, not in a great shape. If they could do something about that wall, everything would be perfect.
reviews.title: perfect for a city break

reviews.text: We were transferred to NH Budapest after our booking at another hotel in Pest fell through. Which is why we were expecting something less than 4*, but NH really exceeded our expectations.
reviews.title: Absolute bargain if you don't mind the out of the way location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not only was the room exactly as it appears in their website pictures (a rarity!), the friendly and helpful staff were such a breath of fresh air. We had slight issues with the wireless connection but there was staff to lend a hand too - a bit above and beyond the call of duty.
reviews.title: Comfortable, quiet, centrally located hotel: great breakfasts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downsides I would consider is 1) the location - it is quite a walk away from the main shopping streets (eg. Vaci utca) and the main downtown hub. This could have been remedied by just catching the metro but we walked across town to get there. Having said that, I think the Westpoint Shopping Centre is on the next block for shopaholics and there are several nice cafes in the area that serves scrumptious food.
reviews.title: NH Hotel Budapest was a bargain with nice location and extremely nice staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2nd downside is the breakfast, which is not included and is a whopping EUR17pp - way too high for Budapest. I would recommend skipping the hotel breakfast and getting a bite to eat at one of the cool cafes and/or bakeries in the area.
reviews.title: Very friendly and courteous staff, would return here again

reviews.text: This object is the typical tourist hotel with rather "tightened" 4 star category.
reviews.title: Good for sightseeing of the town

reviews.text: The location, arrangement, lobby, restaurant are ok. For me only the rooms were too small, but with whole day sightseeing program, it was not the issue.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel. Has everything you need.

reviews.text: The breakfast was very rich, with impressive choice of fresh fruits and local specialities.
reviews.title: Not a 4-star hotel

reviews.text: The underground parking lot, belonging to the hotel, was the other advantage, however not cheap - 16 € per day.
reviews.title: Good location, good quality hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was friendly and helpful, although usually very busy, because of small number of receptionists and waiters comparing to the size of the hotel.
reviews.title: NH does it again!

reviews.text: NH hotels are generally very good value for money and the Budapest hotel is not exception. Very good loaction behind the Vigzinhaz Theatre, 5 mins walk from the main railway station in one direction, and from the Danube and Margret Island in the other. Only downside, buffet breakfast cost €17 pp, but walk straight out the front door and on the main road (Szent Istvan) you have a great choice of cheap cafes (eg, Cafe Europa), patisseries, supermarkets, etc, to get your own breakfast for a fraction of that price. Also, opposite the theatre is the brilliant Szeraj Turkish cafetaria (see restaurant reviews). All in all a very good choice for a base hotel.
reviews.title: NH does it again

reviews.text: NH Budapest is located nearby the centre at Pest side. I stayed only 1 night and visited a Belgian beer bar just around the corner (good place). The hotel is located in a classical building, but leaves a modern impression. Room is large enough, free WiFi, breakfast offering is rich with fresh fruits. Staff was friendly and helpful. NH grants miles for several flyer program card holders (amongst them miles-and-more from Star Alliance).
reviews.title: Centrally Located

reviews.text: I stayed here in the summer of 2008 for 2 nights. The hotel is close to city center and is very convenient. Everything inside the hotel is ok and you can not making a mistake choosing this hotel.
reviews.title: perfect hotel
